newsitem.title: USA: Koch cuts U.S. posted crude prices 75 cts/bbl.
newsitem.headline: Koch cuts U.S. posted crude prices 75 cts/bbl.

text.p: Koch Oil said it cut the price it will pay for U.S. crude oil by 75 cents a barrel, effective today.
The decrease brings the new price for U.S. benchmark grade West Texas Intermediate to $23.50 a barrel, and West Texas Sour to $21.25 a barrel.
Light Louisiana sweet crude is now $23.50 a barrel, and Oklahoma sweet is $23.50.
